Hello! I am Chad Stabler

Welcome to my first three.js project website!

About me:

I'm a software engineer out of Saint Louis, MO and a full time gamer, hobbyist fisherman and fellow R/C enjoyer. I have a knack for trying to find creative solutions to problems, I think I picked it up from all the puzzles in The Uncharted games. My personal best fish is an alligator Gar that was around 5-1/2 feet long, unfortunately I didn't get to weigh it but it felt like it was pushing 35+ pounds. My R/C collection consists of one Traxxas X-MAXX 8s and one ARRMA Kraton 6s. Whenever I find myself outside I like camping/fishing/float trips and usually get dragged into some project that a family member is working on, so I'm used to picking up new things to work on all the time.

Gaming:

Ever since I got a playstation 3 along with a copy of Call of Duty: World at War for Christmas at eight years old, I have been inseparable from my gaming consoles or technology in general for that matter. Looking back I see I grew up in an age where there was the first big RAM and graphical boom to the continued rocket growth of complex three-dimensional spaces in games and the amount of data they can load on demand. I grew up playing everything from shooters and RPGs to playing platformers and strategy games. My favorite games include Warframe, Skyrim, Apex Legends and The Crew.


Fishing:

I've been a fisherman for most of my life, from four years old a long time before I discovered video-games and I likely will be for the rest of my life. My most targeted fish currently blue and flathead catfish, but I like catching whatever I can pull out of the water. I haven't been out fishing much this year, but I hope to find more time for it in the future to refine my skills and figure out tactics that catch me big fish more often. My biggest catfish was a twenty three pound blue and I have caught up to a four pound bass.


R/C:

Driving R/C cars has to be one of my youngest hobbies, I didn't pick it up until I was around twelve when I saved up enough of my holiday money to get my first hobby grade truck, the Traxxas Stampede with rear wheel drive, after that I was completely obsessed with getting a four wheel truck to have more fun off road with, enter Traxxas again as they released their biggest and baddest monster truck model, the X-Maxx, it took me a few years to get the courage to save and pull the trigger on such a big purchase, but when I did, I can confidently say it is big, and it is badass. After running through a few years, a couple of battery chargers and three sets of batteries I decided to set out and acquire a new beast, this time on the Arrma Kraton 6s, after purchasing it in April of this year I can say it may be smaller, but it is a beast of it's own right, and I don't know if I could pick between the two.


Coding:

If you haven't noticed this entire website was written and built wy own hands on the keyboard sitting in front of me. I discovered code while studying for general transfer credits at a nearby community college and realized how fun it is and the logic puzzles you get to work with behind it. After discovering I enjoyed it so much I set out to see how I could turn this enjoyable pass time into a career, after a little searching and a recommendation from a family member I found myself in Alchemy Code Lab, a wonderful tech school for those wanting to get into the tech industry. This website is a side project while going through their courses and my first attempt at learning the three.js library. I also threw in an object from a self taught Blender made creation.


Final comments:

I hope you've enjoyed scrolling through this little introduction of me and seeing the few meshes I created with my first three.js website, I definitely enjoyed making it and introducing myself to three-dimensional models and scenes with code. I hope to continue working with three, but it may only be in side projects to a career in software engineering, either way here's the end of my introduction and this little web page, maybe I will expand with time, but for now I hope this was neat enough to peak your interest.

2022 Chad Stabler
